page.title: 11BISHOPS LYDEARD CARNIVAL
page.content: Every year there is a village Carnival when people individually,in social groups or as village organisations parade through the village on a Saturday afternoon for the enjoyment of others.The larger groups usually construct floats on farm trailers or on lorries to give a backcloth to the people dressed to indicate a theme.There is usually appropiate music playing loudly through speakers on the float.There are also individuals dressed up and walking or riding in many ways.There are classes of entries with cups awarded to the winners and before the Carnival there is great secrecy about each group's entry and on the day much commenting between entries-but never malicious.Heading the Carnival is a band and the elected Carnival Queen and her attendants.
